contentrichtext.text: '''Ji Baocheng''' ([[Chinese character|Chinese]]: 纪宝成; [[Pinyin]]: ''Jì Bǎochéng''; born November 1944) is a Chinese educator, and the former President of [[Renmin University of China]]. ==Biography== Ji Baocheng was born in [[Yangzhou]], [[Jiangsu]] in 1944. He attended the [[Beijing Institute of Business]] from 1962 to 1966. After ten years as a worker in [[Hubei]] province, he returned to Renmin University of China in 1978 as graduate student, teacher, and dean. He moved to the [[Ministry of Commerce of the People's Republic of China|Ministry of Commerce]] in 1991 and to the Higher Education Division of the [[State Education Committee]] in 1996. He was the president of Renmin University of China from 2000 to 2011. Ji was chief editor of several books on [[marketing]], [[Trader (finance)|trading]] and [[management]], the most recent being "A Comparative Study of International Business Education" in 1998. ==External links== * [http://office.ruc.edu.cn/leader/jbc.htm Ji Baocheng's bio at Renmin University's website] {{start box}} {{s-aca}} {{succession box | before = [[Li Wenhai (historian)|Li Wenhai]] | title = President of [[Renmin University of China]] | years = 2000–2011 | after =[[Chen Yulu]] }} {{end box}} {{Authority control|VIAF=205173657}} {{Persondata <!-- Metadata: see [[Wikipedia:Persondata]]. --> | NAME = Ji, Baocheng | ALTERNATIVE NAMES = | SHORT DESCRIPTION = Chinese academic | DATE OF BIRTH = 1944 | PLACE OF BIRTH = | DATE OF DEATH = | PLACE OF DEATH = }} {{DEFAULTSORT:Ji, Baocheng}} [[Category:1944 births]] [[Category:Renmin University of China faculty]] [[Category:Renmin University of China alumni]] [[Category:Living people]] [[Category:People from Yangzhou]] {{China-academic-bio-stub}}
